solution.text:
Volume of a frustum of a cone is \(\frac {\pi}3 \times H \times [r^2 + R^2 + rR] \)
putting the values, H=_{k}_,r=_{{3*j}}_,R=_{{5*j}}_
we get,\(\frac {22}{7\times 3} \times _{k}_ \times [_{{3*j}}_^2 + _{{5*j}}_^2 + _{{15*j*j}}_] \)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*k*(9*j*j+25*j*j+15*j*j)/3,2)}}_\)
Mass of the oil= volume\(\times \) density = _{{trunc(pi_val*k*(9*j*j+25*j*j+15*j*j)/3,2)}}_\(\times \)_{l}_
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*k*l*(9*j*j+25*j*j+15*j*j)/3,2)}}_\)

content.text:
Oil is heated in the vessel shown in the figure.
It is in the shape of a frustum of a cone having the radius of its two circular faces as _{{j*3}}_ cm and _{{5*j}}_ cm and the vertical height of the container is _{k}_ cm
If the density of oil is _{l}_ \(g/cm^3\), find the mass of the oil in the container
